manage_docs_precision_preferred.template: For edits, prefer manage_docs apply_patch (structured mode) or replace_range. Do not hand-craft unified diffs; apply_patch unified mode is compiler output only. replace_section is best reserved for scaffolding templates.
manage_docs_precision_preferred.short_template: Prefer apply_patch/replace_range; use replace_section for scaffolding.
manage_docs_precision_preferred.context: apply_patch = structured by default, replace_range = explicit lines, unified diffs are compiler output only.

manage_docs_scaffold_mode.template: Scaffolding detected: replace_section is OK for template setup. After scaffolding, switch to apply_patch (structured) or replace_range for precise edits.
manage_docs_scaffold_mode.short_template: Scaffold: replace_section OK now; switch to apply_patch/replace_range after.
manage_docs_scaffold_mode.context: Use replace_section only for scaffolding; prefer apply_patch/replace_range for ongoing edits.

manage_docs_normalize_headers.template: normalize_headers runs before TOC generation and outputs numbered ATX headers. It is body-only and skips fenced code blocks.
manage_docs_normalize_headers.short_template: normalize_headers: body-only ATX numbering; skip code fences.
manage_docs_normalize_headers.context: Run normalize_headers before generate_toc to stabilize structure.

manage_docs_generate_toc.template: generate_toc inserts or replaces TOC markers (<!-- TOC:start --> / <!-- TOC:end -->) using deterministic anchors.
manage_docs_generate_toc.short_template: generate_toc: insert/replace TOC markers; deterministic anchors.
manage_docs_generate_toc.context: Body-only, skips fenced code; rerun after headers change.

manage_docs_create_doc.template: create_doc builds docs from content/body/snippets/sections. Users do not supply Jinja. Set register_doc=true only when you want registry updates.
manage_docs_create_doc.context: Use metadata.doc_name/target_dir/frontmatter for custom docs; default is one-off.

manage_docs_validate_crosslinks.template: validate_crosslinks is read-only diagnostics for related_docs. It performs optional anchor checks and does not write or log doc_updates.
